item.title: Other side of Python eval() function
item.description:
The built-in function “eval()” of python is useful in many cases. But I am gonna talk about it’s negative one.

Let, you have a function that take arguments from user. If you do eval() on that input, it might create a havoc.

item.title: What does eval() do in Python?
item.description: I have always loved the fact that The Python interpreter has a number of functions and types built into it. I am going to explore “eval()” in this article.
